poem:
"Ode to a Besieged Brompton"

Once a steed of steel and speed,
Now a languished mare in need.
Intermittent power sighs,
£500 to reprise.
A warranty expired as I waited,
In toils of work, I hesitated.
Now a neglected horse,
A regrettable purchase, of course. 
Nonetheless, your electric petulance,
Echoes human's own ambivalence,
A costly lesson served in plastic and steel,
The price of progress on two wheels.
